projects.title: Club 21
projects.description: My first Mobile Application Game with socket server connection. Great Dealing animations and a first Black Jack Game in South Africa. The game was very popular on Mobile App Booklets (Before App stores).

projects.title: Pirate's Pearls
projects.description: My first Mobile Application Action Game, using a popular match 3 formula at the time.

projects.title: Pharaoh's Fortune
projects.description: Marketing Game for a new Casino, a Slot Machine where players could win actual prizes (Not Money). Winners was still determined Server-Side, but via Random Draw. I used a blur effect from Photoshop to FAKE speed when the wheels spun. This was in 2007 and I have never seen anyone else do this effect like this, which I'm Proud of.

projects.title: Pyramids of Treasure
projects.description: Another slot machine game, for another company with more elaborate combinations, also Server-Side Win draw.

projects.title: Taxi Jam
projects.description: Rush Hour game clone, but with a South African twist. The vehicles even had damage applied when trying to pass an impassible car (block).

projects.title: Tetra Lift
projects.description: A marketing campaign from Puma's shoes. The idea was that the shoes were so light, they float. So we made a Tetris clone, where the blocks would float upwards, instead of dropping downwards. The shoes were in the Tetris Blocks, making them float.
